author: gloslegofan
title: Fantastic Daredevil Stunt Biplane to soar above your Lego City
review:
Pieces

The stunt pilot's torso is unique, and printed on both sides. It's use is probably limited to other 'daredevil' scenarios. Crash Bar 4x6x3 I believe appears for the first time in white.

The completed model

The biplane looks fun and colourful (with all-American colours) and has a good 'whoosh-ability'. The propellor has minimal friction so can be easily spun with a finger or by blowing on it. There is a hint of an engine, complete with white smoke, behind the propellor. There are two ailerons on the top wing that can be tilted up and down, perhaps giving the possibility of posing the aircraft doing a realistic aerobatic 'roll', although I am no expert on this! The structure is very sturdy, much stronger than it may look.

There doesn't appear to be any compromises, and it looks good from any angle, except from directly underneath.

Overall opinion

This a fantastic, colourful, and fun stunt plane which will soar above the heads of the minfigs in your Lego City - aided by invisible string of course.

author: KarolWes
title: Great Bi-Plane
review:
Thanks to my friends I was able to build this set. And so here is a review.

Model I - Bi-Plane

I always was a big fan of planes of all kind, and since Adventure series bi-planes become my favorite. This plane is undoubtedly one of the best of its kind in last couple years. I like how LEGO decided to made lower wings - they are attached on clips and are angled up a bit. Ruder is also designed pretty well - it is built on side, which allows to made a great looking stripes. On upper wing there are two movable flaps, which for me are perfect touch. Canopy is really simple, has one lever and single consol. Engine is also nothing fancy, but small white feathers that are meant to be exhaust gases add a lot. Landing gears are very big, it its ok.

It is made mostly in whites and reds. This combo works wonderful - add some aggressive vibe. There are also additions in blue and some gold highlights.

Building process is quite simple, but not so obvious. Many parts are attached by clips.

Model II - Rocket car

This thing looks like small, but deadly fast plane with wheels. I know that things like this exist, but still I think it doesn't look so well. As a model it is great. It is designed pretty nice, has a lot of details, it is a completed craft. But this what is here portrayed is inappropriate. I like it's look though. Small wings can be folded up, engine is not too big, canopy is designed great. So overall, this thing is good.

Model III - Boat

It is typical for LEGO to give a boat in set with a plane. This boat in here is very simple but looks fantastic. It is sleek, designed great, engine is ridiculously big, but overall it is great small model. I like especially exhaust pipes.

Minifig

We have here one pilot for our crafts. He is wearing greatly looking flight jacket with flame pattern. Jacket has nice zip and greatly printed collar. At the bottom of torso is a simple belt. Arms are unprinted and white, he is wearing red gloves and has blue legs.

His face is nothing special - big smile, big eyebrows. Looks good. And also he has a standard helmet with flight goggles.

Parts

Most important parts in this set are curved bricks - in red and blue. Out of more interesting ones we have also 4x6 plate with bars, stud with hole, 1x1 round tile with printed star and new macaroni piece. To sum up - great parts.

[img]https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AR5Krv9WpfbCNVLFLu4eaVbBowCmKdHnlClKX_cuSzKP2EsGIGSr5HMJPEUJb3jm3u8xN3evzO1Y__kQjGIQsKqAws8p9xOkNct_At-2RznFfrAfWb07AbHtU9XEJXN5H85LsoTAwE9cQ4Hzp-vxcSu0dd93ywFyD4aro-fz2QXf9pxf57-SIDu25h4KlIZiypdPRLkrhXNwazsws4m5JxOGRXAPvNFPkW68aUYAfB1iJKCcNFOSPht4tXxXpLqFXsBJJVaah6zmxrKTAg6hkVzHOHw_1X8QvgZ8LeHjLQHpxrmWcoa02K7djCo9cUAqV5pjPfK5IrEkXtTcQkN4_q24dqX783oc0E-1hEYDPCJjRfnAjqprr3jjyhCoH2Rha6hS3E25diMD3ZSLPk8LAgUW9CW83hK4wKL7NoPl6GpELh9ibuKdZJznwY-pxzx3DU3vP67RBd1hePlGIFZ7LdS230Atp-Pd53RPWmfsYfHwguBNloS6znutI8FWMzQTaAeZRNOhotSbDrIDiZ-jcESdpqZVls2K2fkjOvHVf_FoCKXswRf4C-AWL6zrF8IIXwhz-uka6hIv_kgrz8NXZvGEECU1Szmrfa4ATi17WqSbopm6joaajqBsrNxQLKzTbWnBdi-nk5Ll534Sq6TyI5wFEkKkvnZ_J6GhlJT-MMWfhvle4E46jQ0=w1251-h938-no[/img]

Summary

  • Bi-plane looks the best - angled wings, moving flaps, nice color combo.
  • Rocket car - I'm not a fan of things like this, but model is great.
  • Boat - typical, but fantastic addition.
  • Minifig is simple yet perfectly looking.
  • Many red curves, and quite a lot of new parts.

All models are very sturdy and allows kids to play without much carefulness.
